description: The largest ship class in the game, boasting high armor, large caliber main battery,

On the tech tree, battleships starts at tier 3 after researching a tier 3 cruiser of the same nation. All battleships have access to Repair Party, allowing to them to recover some damage taken over time. They also have access to Spotting Aircraft, extending their gun range by 20%. Depending on the nation, some are equipped with Hydroacoustic Search or Engine Boost
battleships.title: Battleships

description: Versatile and small, destroyers can destroy targets many times their weight with rapid-firing guns or torpedoes.
On the tech tree, destroyers starts at tier 2 after researching a tier 2 cruiser of the same nation.
Most destroyers have access to Smoke Generator, allowing them to break contact from the enemy or provide concealment for allies. Most nations have access to Engine Boost.
$red_dash Often harassed by aircraft and radar-equipped cruisers
destroyers.title: Destroyers

description: The most versatile ship type, capable of doing almost any naval tasks.
On the tech tree, cruisers starts at tier 1 and it is the starting ship for most nations.
They are equipped with various consumables, their range of consumables depending on their nation and type.
Cruisers are split into several different categories; light, heavy, and super.
- Light cruisers are equipped with guns of less than 155mm in diameter.
- Heavy cruisers are equipped with guns of about 203mm in diameter.
- Supercruisers are equipped with guns larger than 203 mm in diameter.
cruisers.title: Cruisers

description: The floating airfield, capable of precision airstrikes anywhere.

On the tech tree, aircraft carriers starts at tier 4 after researching a tier 4 battleship of the same nation. Aircraft carriers are available on even tiers and on the United States, British, Russian, German, and Japanese tech trees. Tech tree aircraft compose of three flight groups consisting of: attack aircraft, torpedo bombers, dive bombers, or skip bombers.
aircraft carriers.title: Aircraft Carriers

description: In WoWS, every anti-air armament will deal damage, and is split into different auras with different ranges: close, mid, and long. Anti-air armaments comes in two categories: flak and continuous.
**Continuous AA** continuously deals damage to any squadrons within range every second. Continuous accuracy lowers the damage stated on the AA parameter.
**Flak** will fire an explosive anti-air round ahead of the squadron's position about every 2 seconds. Flak's accuracy determines how often should the explosion appear in front of the squadron.
anti-air.title: Anti-Air

description: mackbot's AA rating (mbAA or mAAr) is a AA rating value custom to mackbot, separately from what the in-game value dictates. mbAA rating assumes the attacking squadron is of the same tier.
mbAA is calculation is as follows:

```continuous = ((shortDamage * shortHitChance) + (midDamage * midHitChance * 1.5) + (midDamage * midHitChance * 2))
rangeScaling = (aaMaxRange / 5800) ^ 3
flak = flakExplosionCount * flakHitChance * 2
aa_rating = ((continuous / (shipTier * 9)) * rangeScaling) + flak```
mackbot aa rating.title: Mackbot's AA Rating

description: $green_plus Equipped with enhanced Repair Party (2%/s vs. 0.5%/s on most cruisers)
$green_plus CLs have short-fused AP shells, smoke or radar, and devastating AA
$green_plus Devastating, high fire starting chance HE shells
$green_plus Equipped with enhanced Repair Party (2%/s vs. 0.5%/s on most battleships)
$red_dash Lower health pool vs. other battleships
$green_plus Relatively higher plane health pool vs. other nations
united kingdom.title: The Royal Navy
